text.*:
This article relies too much on references to primary sources. Please improve this by adding secondary or tertiary sources. (February 2016) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

Billboard Women in Music is an annual event held by Billboard. Its main award is titled Woman of the Year, established to recognize "women in the music industry who have made significant contributions to the business and who, through their work and continued success, inspire generations of women to take on increasing responsibilities within the field" according to the magazine.[1]

Contents

  • 1 Woman of the Year award
  • 2 Rising Star award
  • 3 Triple Threat Award
  • 4 Rulebreaker Award
  • 5 Trailblazer Award
  • 6 Group of the Year
  • 7 Chart-Topper
  • 8 Icon of the Year
  • 9 Impact Award
  • 10 Legend Award
  • 11 Breakthrough
  • 12 Hitmaker
  • 13 Innovator
  • 14 Powerhouse
  • 15 References

Woman of the Year award[edit]

In 2007, Reba McEntire was honored with Billboard's first Woman of the Year Award because of "her success as a recording artist, contributions to the business, and leadership in embracing the changing music business."[1] Every year since then, Billboard has honored a female artist with the award. Lady Gaga, Selena Gomez and Taylor Swift are the only women to have more than one award. The most recent winner of this award is Selena Gomez[2].

  • 2007: Reba McEntire
  • 2008: Ciara
  • 2009: Beyoncé
  • 2010: Fergie
  • 2011: Taylor Swift
  • 2012: Katy Perry
  • 2013: Pink
  • 2014: Taylor Swift
  • 2015: Lady Gaga
  • 2016: Madonna
  • 2017: Selena Gomez

Rising Star award[edit]

In 2008, Colbie Caillat was honored with Billboard's first Rising Star award because of "her ascent in the pop charts and the repercussion that her music caused." Every year since then, Billboard has honored a female artist with the award.

  • 2008: Colbie Caillat
  • 2009: Lady Gaga[3]
  • 2011: Nicki Minaj[4]
  • 2012: Carly Rae Jepsen
  • 2014: Ariana Grande
  • 2016: Halsey
  • 2017: Grace VanderWaal

Triple Threat Award[edit]

In 2010, Lea Michele was honored with Billboard's First-Ever Triple Threat Award because of her "excellence in performance across acting, singing and dancing."[5]

  • 2010: Lea Michele

Rulebreaker Award[edit]

  • 2015: Demi Lovato[6]
  • 2016: Alessia Cara
  • 2017: Kehlani

Trailblazer Award[edit]

  • 2014: Hayley Williams[7]
  • 2015: Lana Del Rey
  • 2016: Kesha[8]

Group of the Year[edit]

  • 2015: Fifth Harmony[9]

Chart-Topper[edit]

  • 2014: Iggy Azalea[10]
  • 2015: Selena Gomez
  • 2016: Meghan Trainor[11]

Icon of the Year[edit]

  • 2014: Aretha Franklin[12]
  • 2016: Shania Twain[13]
  • 2017: Mary J. Blige

Impact Award[edit]

  • 2017: Solange Knowles

Legend Award[edit]

  • 2015: Loretta Lynn[14]

Breakthrough[edit]

  • 2014: Idina Menzel
  • 2015: Tori Kelly[15]
  • 2016: Maren Morris[16]
  • 2017: Camila Cabello

Hitmaker[edit]

  • 2014: Charli XCX

Innovator[edit]

  • 2015: Missy Elliott[17]

Powerhouse[edit]

  • 2014: Jessie J
  • 2015: Brittany Howard
  • 2016: Andra Day[18]
  • 2017: Kelly Clarkson
